section: Exercise 4.4.2: Using the bijection rule to count binary strings with even parity.
instructions: Let B = {0, 1}. B n is the set of binary strings with n bits. Define the set E n to be the set of binary strings with n bits that have an even number of 1's. Note that zero is an even number, so a string with zero 1's (i.e., a string that is all 0's) has an even number of 1's.
question:
(a)

Show a bijection between B 9 and E 10 .
